intro: Atalaya alata, commonly known as the spreading atalaya, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically five to seven lobes. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
